history.content: I took it last summer. I don't know about normal semesters, but the summer workload was pretty minimal and the projects (iirc there were ~3 projects but the first 2 projects were not really substantial) didn't take long. Maybe 1-2 hours if you were already familiar with Max 7.

children.subject:
The class is essentially teaching you how to use Max and make your own patches, so the projects were very open-ended. A big part of the class revolved around using CNMAT's custom library/add-on for Max called "odot". (Check out these links: https://www.ableton.com/en/live/max-for-live/, https://cycling74.com/products/new-max-version-8/, and https://github.com/CNMAT/CNMAT-odot). A typical project prompt would be like "build a patch that uses the X, Y, Z features that we learnt about in class". 
Classes took place in Tolman's computer labs, and were all structured essentially like your typical 61abc labs; the prof will explain/demonstrate something new in Max and we got to mess around with it. Overall I thought the class was super cool, but maybe that's because I was already really interested in music/sound synthesis. Also this was like a 5 person class over the summer so things may be different during the semester when the class gets much larger.
What do you do in that class? What are projects like?
I think math 1b + music 158a together will still be pretty chill compared to 61c, so I guess it depends on what type of summer workload you want to have.
I am considering taking either CS61C OR Math1B and Music 158A over the summer. Which seems like the smarter decision?

history.content:
Has anyone taken Music 158A? If so, what was it like? How heavy is the courseload? How much work is it compared to other classes?

Thanks!
history.subject: Music 158A
